events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle on a busy intersection yesterday.
The filed claim was categorised under Auto Accident category after reviewing initial case details.
A claims agent was assigned promptly to assist the customer with the auto accident claim.
The insurance company sent an official acknowledgment letter to the customer confirming claim receipt.
Requested police report, driver's license, vehicle registration, and photos of the accident scene.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed images showing the collision damage.
Claims investigation team began assessing the details and verifying the facts surrounding the collision.
Investigation concluded confirming liability was with the third party, no fault found with customer.
Settlement offer sent to customer covering repair costs and rental car expenses during auto vehicle repairs.
Customer responded expressing satisfaction with prompt service and fair settlement amount offered.
Claim officially approved by management following customer’s acceptance of proposed settlement terms.
Payment for repair costs and rental car services was issued to the customer’s registered bank account.
The auto accident claim case was officially closed after full settlement payment was confirmed.
Case documents and records archived for future reference and compliance with insurance regulations.
